item.title: Part 1. Basic Concepts. Arithmetic of Remainders.
item.description:
#Subject of Study

This section studies, strangely enough, numbers and their properties. We will examine some of them necessary for the start.

Let’s start with the types of numbers. The image below shows the types of number sets as nested ellipses. We will move from the smaller to the larger:

$$ \mathbb{P} \subset \mathbb{N} \subset \mathbb{Z} \subset \mathbb{Q} \subset \mathbb{R} \subset \mathbb{C} $$

What do these letters mean?

$\mathbb{P}$ â€” the set of prime numbers. Prime numbers are those that are divisible by themselves and by one. The set of prime numbers is not actually a strict subset of natural numbers. True mathematicians may criticize me for the picture I made and for what I wrote, but I will explain my choice as follows: any element (number) of the prime set is also an element of any higher set. In this section, we will often work with prime numbers because of their unique properties.
